metadata.title: CVE-2022-48619 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/input/input.c in the Linux kernel before5.17.10. An attacker can cause a denial of service (panic) becauseinput_set_capability mishandles the situation in which an event code fallsoutside of a bitmap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1139-aws - 4.15.0-1139.150~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-gcp - 4.15.0-1134.150~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1104-oracle - 4.15.0-1104.115~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
